title: NaOH-HCl titration curve - heat released double mL

content.question: A student conducted an experiment to determine <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>Δ</mtext><msubsup> <mi>H</mi> <mrow> <mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow> <mo>∘</mo> </msubsup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGuoGaamisam aaDaaaleaacaWGYbGaamiEaiaad6gaaeaacqWIyiYBaaaaaa@3F33@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> for the reaction between <math> <mrow> <mtext> HCl </mtext> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mi> a </mi> <mi> q </mi> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mtext> NaOH </mtext> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mi> a </mi> <mi> q </mi> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> . The student ran two trials using the volumes of <math> <mrow> <mtext> HCl </mtext> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mi> a </mi> <mi> q </mi> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mtext> NaOH </mtext> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mi> a </mi> <mi> q </mi> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> indicated in the table above, and determined the amount of heat released. Which of the following best explains the relationship between X and Y?

choices.label: Y = 2X, because the volume of HCl(aq) used in trial 2 is twice the volume used in trial 1.
Y = X, because the number of moles of acid and base reacting with each other is the same in both trials.
Y = 2X / 3 , because the heat is distributed over more particles in trial 2 than in trial 1.
The relationship between X and Y cannot be predicted.

content.answer: Y = X, because the number of moles of acid and base reacting with each other is the same in both trials.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
